page.title: 01LILLESHALL-CHURCH ASTON
page.content: If you walk up Lilleshall Hill you can see most of our area. To the north a patchwork of fields; to the east the village of Church Aston and Newport; to the south Lilleshall Village tucked under the hill and beyond it farmland again. To the west is Telford outside our boundary. The monument on the hill is a Shropshire landmark. It was erected in 1833 in memory of the 1st. Duke of Sutherland who owned most of this area and beyond until 1917. The Duke's cottages are a feature of this area, many having been renovated and extended. You may still trace some of the limestone quarries and canals built here over 200 years ago. The railway too has gone, now being replaced by a new road. Today most of the area is covered in rich, deep, green corn waiting to be harvested after we have finished our survey.
